sentences: Damini Ebunoluwa Ogulu (born 2 July 1991), known professionally as Burna Boy, is a Nigerian singer and rapper.

sentences: He is one of the biggest and most successful African artists.
section: N/A

sentences: He rose to prominence in 2012 after releasing "Like to Party", the lead single from his debut studio album L.I.F. E (2013).

sentences: In 2017, Burna Boy signed with Bad Habit/Atlantic Records in the United States and Warner Music Group internationally.
section: N/A

sentences: His third studio album Outside marked his major-label debut.

sentences: His fourth studio album African Giant was released in July 2019; it won Album of the Year at the 2019 All Africa Music Awards and was nominated for a Best World Music Album at the 62nd Annual Grammy Awards.

sentences: He was awarded the African Artist of the year at the 2020 VGMA's.

== Early life and education ==

sentences: Damini Ogulu was born in Port Harcourt.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: His father managed a welding company and his mother worked as a translator.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: His grandfather Benson Idonije once managed Fela Kuti.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: His mother Bose Ogulu would later become his manager.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: Ogulu grew up in southern Nigeria and began making his own beats using FruityLoops.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: He attended Corona Secondary School in Agbara (Ogun State) and relocated to London to further his studies.

sentences: He later studied Media Technology at the University of Sussex.

sentences: Burna Boy's debut studio album L.I.F. E was released on 12 August 2013, serving as the follow-up to his second mixtape Burn Identity (2011).

sentences: The album sold 40,000 copies on the first day of its release.

sentences: Nigeria Entertainment Today ranked the album 10th on its list of the 12th Best Albums of 2013.

sentences: The album's music draws heavily from the music of Fela Kuti, King Sunny Ade and Bob Marley.

sentences: On 21 March 2019, Burna Boy released a 4-track collaborative EP with Los Angeles-based electronic duo DJDS, titled Steel & Copper.

sentences: It blends Burna Boy's upbeat melodies with DJDS' slinky trap beats.

sentences: Controversies ==

sentences: Burna Boy's outspoken views have made him a controversial figure in the Nigerian and African entertainment industry.
section: == Controversies ==

sentences: He has been in a feud with South African rapper AKA over anti-Nigerian tweets.
section: == Controversies ==

sentences: In July 2019, Burna Boy posted controversial and threatening tweets after South Africa lost to Nigeria at the 2019 Africa Cup of Nations.
section: == Controversies ==

sentences: On 28 November 2019, Burna Boy was involved in an altercation with fellow Nigerian musician Davido at a nightclub in Accra, Ghana.
section: == Controversies ==

sentences: The altercation resulted in the night club's bouncers escorting Burna Boy and his entourage out of the building.
section: == Controversies ==

sentences: This was a result of a feud between the two that started over Instagram.
